sections.heading: Join Two Lists
sections.description: There are several ways to join, or concatenate, two or more lists in Python. One of the easiest ways are by using the + operator. Another way to join two lists is by appending all the items from list2 into list1, one by one: Or you can use the extend() method, where the purpose is to add elements from one list to another list:

code_blocks.code:
list1 = ["a", "b" , "c"]
list2 = [1, 2, 3]


for x in list2:
»»list1.append(x)

print(list1)

code_blocks.notes: Use the extend() method to add list2 at the end of list1:
